db:abstract.db:para: The QXmlSchemaValidator class validates XML instance documents against a W3C XML Schema.
This class was introduced in Qt 4.6.

db:note.db:para: All functions in this class are reentrant.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: The QXmlSchemaValidator class loads, parses an XML instance document and validates it against a W3C XML Schema that has been compiled with QXmlSchema.

db:section.db:title: XML Schema Version
db:section.db:para: This class implements schema validation according to the XML Schema 1.0 specification.

db:section.db:title: QXmlSchemaValidator::QXmlSchemaValidator()
db:section.db:para: Constructs a schema validator. The schema used for validation must be referenced in the XML instance document via the xsi:schemaLocation or xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation attribute.

db:section.db:title: QXmlSchemaValidator::QXmlSchemaValidator(const QXmlSchema &schema)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a schema validator that will use schema for validation. If an empty QXmlSchema schema is passed to the validator, the schema used for validation must be referenced in the XML instance document via the xsi:schemaLocation or xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation attribute.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] QXmlSchemaValidator::~QXmlSchemaValidator()
db:section.db:para: Destroys this QXmlSchemaValidator.

db:section.db:title: QAbstractMessageHandler *QXmlSchemaValidator::messageHandler() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the message handler that handles parsing and validation messages for this QXmlSchemaValidator.

db:section.db:title: QXmlNamePool QXmlSchemaValidator::namePool() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the name pool used by this QXmlSchemaValidator for constructing names. There is no setter for the name pool, because mixing name pools causes errors due to name confusion.

db:section.db:title: QNetworkAccessManager *QXmlSchemaValidator::networkAccessManager() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the network manager, or 0 if it has not been set.

db:section.db:title: QXmlSchema QXmlSchemaValidator::schema() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the schema that is used for validation.

db:section.db:title: void QXmlSchemaValidator::setMessageHandler(QAbstractMessageHandler *handler)
db:section.db:para: Changes the message handler for this QXmlSchemaValidator to handler. The schema validator sends all parsing and validation messages to this message handler. QXmlSchemaValidator does not take ownership of handler.
Normally, the default message handler is sufficient. It writes compile and validation messages to stderr. The default message handler includes color codes if stderr can render colors.

db:td.db:para: Only QtWarningMsg and QtFatalMsg are used. The former identifies a warning, while the latter identifies an error.
An XHTML document which is the actual message. It is translated into the current language.
Identifies the error with a URI, where the fragment is the error code, and the rest of the URI is the error namespace.

db:section.db:title: void QXmlSchemaValidator::setNetworkAccessManager(QNetworkAccessManager *manager)
db:section.db:para: Sets the network manager to manager. QXmlSchemaValidator does not take ownership of manager.

db:section.db:title: void QXmlSchemaValidator::setSchema(const QXmlSchema &schema)
db:section.db:para: Sets the schema that shall be used for further validation. If the schema is empty, the schema used for validation must be referenced in the XML instance document via the xsi:schemaLocation or xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation attribute.

db:section.db:title: void QXmlSchemaValidator::setUriResolver(const QAbstractUriResolver *resolver)
db:section.db:para: Sets the URI resolver to resolver. QXmlSchemaValidator does not take ownership of resolver.

db:section.db:title: const QAbstractUriResolver *QXmlSchemaValidator::uriResolver() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the schema's URI resolver. If no URI resolver has been set, Qt XML Patterns will use the URIs in instance documents as they are.
The URI resolver provides a level of abstraction, or polymorphic URIs. A resolver can rewrite logical URIs to physical ones, or it can translate obsolete or invalid URIs to valid ones.
When Qt XML Patterns calls QAbstractUriResolver::resolve() the absolute URI is the URI mandated by the schema specification, and the relative URI is the URI specified by the user.
